chapter.title: Overview of Steps and Tasks

abstract.para: This chapter provides an overview of the common steps and tasks for installation, setup, configuration, and administration of a cluster.

chapter.para: The following steps are necessary to install, set up, and configure a cluster with &productnamereg;:

formalpara.title: Installation and basic setup
formalpara.para: Depending on the deployment method, the following substeps are either part of an automated process or must be executed manually.

formalpara.title: Storage Configuration
formalpara.para: Depending on your requirements, you may also want to configure the following file system and storage-related components for your cluster:

listitem.para: Create file systems on a shared disk (Storage Area Network, SAN). If necessary, configure those file systems as cluster resources.
If you need cluster-aware file systems, use OCFS2.
To allow the cluster to manage shared storage with Logical Volume Manager, use cLVM, which is a set of clustering extensions to LVM.
To protect your data integrity, implement storage protection by using fencing mechanisms and by ensuring exclusive storage access.
If needed, make use of data replication with DRBD*.
